Pre-Game Insights: West Indies will clash with South Africa in the opener of the three-match T20I series at the Brian Lara Stadium in Tarouba in Trinidad.
West Indies are ranked fourth in the ICC T20I Rankings whereas South Africa are one place behind at number 5.
The hosts will be led by Rovman Powell, while South Africa will be captained by Aiden Markram.

West Indies likely XI includes Shimron Hetmyer, Rovman Powell, Sherfane Rutherford, Romario Shepherd, Roston Chase, Fabian Allen, Nicholas Pooran, Shai Hope, Akeal Hosein, Shamar Joseph, and Obed McCoy.

South Africa likely XI includes Rassie van der Dussen, Reeza Hendricks, Tristan Stubbs, Jason Smith, Aiden Markram, Wiaan Mulder, Donovan Ferreira, Lungi Ngidi, Nandre Burger, Lizaad Williams, and Kwena Maphaka.
The Brian Lara Stadium at Tarouba in Trinidad has hosted 9 T20Is with the team batting first coming out victorious in 4 of these encounters.
The average team total batting first at the venue is 128 while the average score chasing is 112.

England blasted 267 for 3 against the West Indies at Tarouba in December, 2023 which is the highest team total in a contest between two major Test playing nations in T20I cricket and the fifth-highest overall.
South Africa and West Indies have faced each other in 23 T20Is and the Proteas have a marginal edge with a 12-11 head to head record.
West Indies have won four of the last 5 encounters between the two teams.
West Indies start marginal favourites as they will benefit from the home conditions and also have a more destructive batting unit. West Indies have a 60% chance of winning the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The spinners have made as much of an impact as the pacers at the venue.
